name: Magnolia grandiflora
Modalities: Worse: lying on left side; in morning on first rising

Heart: Feeling of a large bolus of food which distressed the stomach
Pain around heart accompanied by itching of the feet
Oppression of chest with inability to expand the lungs
Suffocated feeling when walking fast or lying on left side
Sensation as if heart had stopped beating
Extremities: Stiffness and sharp erratic pains; worse in joints

details: Rheumatism and cardiac lesions are prominent features in the symptomatology of this drug. STIFFNESS and soreness. Alternating pains between spleen and heart. Patient tired and stiff. Soreness when quiet. Erratic shifting of pains.
